definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Some of these overflows have darkened the northwestern flanks.

sentences.english: A city of west-central Russia in the eastern foothills of the Ural Mountains.

sentences.english: God foothills of the two tree, the legend of the Southern Song Xianchun for years by planting.

sentences.english: The a - ma temple was built by the cliff . there are winding paths around upwards the hill.
sentences.chinese: 媽閣廟依崖而建，沿山麓迂迴小徑，拾級而上。

sentences.english: The lake lies low by the hill; a tearful entreiny of love in the foot of the inflexible.

sentences.english: Uncommon in tropical submontane forests up to 1200 m.
sentences.chinese: 不常見於高至海拔1200米的熱帶山麓森林。

sentences.english: That year , I prayed and crawled along the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 那一年，磕長頭匍匐在山麓。

sentences.english: There is hardly a valley or mountainside where folk cannot tell you of some one pillaged from amongst them.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每個山谷或是山麓都不乏關於擄掠的民間故事。

sentences.english: An abandoned coal mine in sub-urban of Taipei which is covered with a cabin.
sentences.chinese: 臺北市信義區拇指山麓的廢礦坑口，已被加蓋鐵皮屋。

sentences.english: At the same time, the Beatles flew to foothills of the Himalayas to learn meditation.
sentences.chinese: 同時，披頭們飛到喜馬拉雅山脈的山麓下，學習冥想。

sentences.english: Northeast surrounded on three sides by mountains, west piedmont zone close to the edge of the city.
sentences.chinese: 東北西三面山地環抱，山麓地帶接近城市邊緣。
